meanings.definition: A document summarizing experience and qualifications.
examples: Most high school students learn to write a resumé that includes all of their work and volunteer experiences, as well as academic achievements.

images.alt: Photo of two pieces of paper on a desk.
images.description: Two pages of a resume on a table. One page contains charts and graphs, the other page lists a person's name, and then has text under categories like Experience, Education, References, Professional Statement, and Skills.
images.caption: This resume includes tables, charts, and written information.

source.title: Two White Printer Papers Near Macbook on Brown Surface
source.author: Lukas

meanings.definition: Duty; the ability to act independently
examples: Jason thought having a job would teach him about responsibility as well as help him earn some extra cash.
Jason put together a resumé to help him acquire a job.

images.alt: Photo of a 'Sold' sign in front of a house.
images.description: A 'Sold' sign in front of a house.
images.caption: When you acquire a house, you take on a lot of responsibility.

meanings.definition: To sense or be aware of; to view in a certain way
examples: When students get a job, their bosses and coworkers perceive them as responsible adults.
As it turns out, Jason could not sustain his good grades while working

meanings.definition: To set apart or give out for a particular use
examples: His leader assigned him this bunk while he was at camp.

images.alt: Photo of a teacher in a classroom.
images.description: A teacher stands in a classroom. A board with work she has assigned is in the background.
images.caption: A teacher assigns things for her students to do during the day.

examples: Their bosses and co-workers see them as responsible adults.

meanings.definition: A place where someone or something is located or has been put.
examples: Mrs. Snell had taken up her position on the bottom step of the stairs.

images.alt: Photo of a guard next to the entrance of a building.
images.description: A guard stands next to an entrance to Buckingham Palace.
images.caption: The guard is positioned next to the entrance of the palace.

meanings.definition: An advantage or profit gained from something.
examples: Enjoy the benefits of being a member of the club, because not everyone gets them!

images.description: Two people standing next to each other holding a paper.
images.caption: One of the benefits of having a job is that you get to work with and learn from others.

meanings.definition: To state or assert that something is the case.
examples: These sunblocks claim that they can protect you from the sun's harmful rays.
Their bosses and co-workers see them as dependable adults.

meanings.definition: an advantage or profit gained from something.
examples: Enjoy the perks of being a member of the club, because not everyone gets them!

images.description: Two people standing next to each other holding a paper.
images.caption: One of the perks of having a job is that you get to work with and learn from others.

meanings.definition: To state or demand as one's right.
examples: These sunblocks allege that they can protect you from the sun's harmful rays.
